action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit foreign nations from owning certain facilities, buildings, and land.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protection of American Land Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibition against foreign nations owning certain facilities, buildings, and land

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a foreign nation may notâ€”

paragraph.text: establish a police or State sponsored security facility;
own or purchase a State sponsored government building in the United States; or
own or purchase land in the United States.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, if a foreign nation owns a facility, building, or land described in subsection (a), such foreign nation shall be provided market-rate compensation for such facility, building, or property within two years of the date of the enactment of this Act by the Secretary of Treasury.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a foreign nation owning a facility, building, or land described in subsection (a) such foreign nation shall return such facility, building, or land to the United States Government.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the United States Government shall not be liable for any violation of contracts that occur as a result of this Act.

paragraph.text: The term foreign nation includes a foreign nation, a State sponsored entity, or a government official of a foreign nation.

paragraph.header: Police or State sponsored security facility
paragraph.text: The term police or State sponsored security facility means a facility that conducts security, espionage, acts of law enforcement, or surveillance on United States citizens.
The term State sponsored government building means a building owned by a foreign nation.
